author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Wisconsian lands, the Trump kin does gain,
Where shot-cast clouds disrupt the court's refrain.
Upon assassination's heels, the gathering's blight,
Once king's peril twines with convention's night.

Bank earnings approach, JPMorgan leading,
Citigroup follows the financial tiding.
Stern lookouts eye banking system's plight,
For interest, higher-for-longer, fans the fright.

Kagame, hailed chief, cloak'd in election glory,
Landslide dissembled by Rwanda's story,
Where poverty claws and neighbours contemn,
In Congo’s heart, issues joust and stem.

feedItems.title: Trump Is Gaining in Wisconsin, Where Shooting Casts Cloud Over Start of RNC
feedItems.description: The convention comes on the heels of the assassination attempt on former president.

feedItems.title: JPMorgan, Citigroup to Kick Off Bank Earnings
feedItems.description: Investors will be on the lookout for more signs of weakness in the banking system, as well as the impact of higher-for-longer interest rates.

feedItems.title: Kagame's Expected Election Landslide Disguises Growing Problems for Rwanda
feedItems.description: The country struggles with high poverty rates and growing criticism of its meddling in neighboring Congo.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Golden yield, once in merry play,
Falls soft as a dove in twilight's sway.
A snail-like slide, shy of the sun's ray,
Loyal to the $2,400 boulevard's array.

Firm as a hound, gilt yield holds the day,
A rabbit in the thicket, alert but at bay.
Awaiting the morrow's inflation ballet,
Seeks insight, as morning seeks the ray.

Oil, once proud as a hawk in mid-May,
Slips, as Trump's fortunes sway.
Dark talks of the bullet's foray,
In Pennsylvania's dramatic play.

feedItems.title: Gold Futures Pare Gains After Thursday Rally But Stay Above $2,400 Mark
feedItems.description: Gold futures fell but remained above the $2,400 mark after the softer-than-expected U.S. inflation data on Thursday boosted the case for a dovish pivot towards easing monetary policy at the July Federal Reserve meeting, JPMorgan said.

feedItems.title: Gilt Yields Relatively Steady, Focus on Wednesday's U.K. Inflation Data
feedItems.description: Gilt yields were largely unchanged as investors looked ahead to Wednesday’s U.K. inflation data to gain insight on when the Bank of England could starting cutting interest rates.

feedItems.title: Oil Slips on Stronger U.S. Dollar After Trump Assassination Attempt
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged down as the dollar gained, with investors speculating about the chances of Trump winning the upcoming U.S. election in the wake of the weekend shooting in Pennsylvania.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
A tune to the Sachs of Goldman, their earnings now in light,
Fourth quarters bearing gold, in analysts' sight,
Verily, the season of gain doth crest, 
In this marketplace of fervour and incessant quest.

Next, the sovereign dollar, amidst ebbing stocks doth tower,
Surviving Trump's attempted fall, within the fatal hour,
Economies of orient lands, their growth doth slow,
Yet, market hearts scarce feel the blow.

Lastly, Swatch, the clockmaker, its profits lost in time,
To the Eastern realm's diminished chime.
Yet, brave do they face the year, fraught with dismay,
In pursuit of tomorrow, come what may.

feedItems.title: Goldman Sachs Earnings in Spotlight
feedItems.description: Earnings season revs up this week, with analysts expecting S&P 500 companies to report a fourth straight quarter of earnings growth.

feedItems.title: Dollar Edges Higher as Stocks Weaken, Limited Impact From Trump Assassination Attempt
feedItems.description: The safe-haven dollar edged higher, helped by falls in equities after data showed second-quarter Chinese economic growth slowed significantly, while the assassination attempt on Donald Trump had limited impact on markets, ING said.

feedItems.title: Swatch Profits Hit by Weaker Chinese Demand
feedItems.description: Swatch reported a steep drop in first-half sales and profits on weaker demand for luxury goods in China, and cautioned it expected the Chinese market to remain challenging until the end of the year.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
From Atos firm, news doth unfurl,
A deal signed, in finance world whirl.
Talks of rescue now lie in ruin,
Onepoint's hopes, now desolation's boon.

In a land where drakes take wing and soar,
Luxury shares on market floor.
In China's maw, demand wanes thin,
Fades the allure of earthly sin.

Burberry's chief, cast out in the cold,
As company's woes, like tales of old.
Turnaround stalled, no dividend feast,
A fizzling effort, to say the least.

feedItems.title: Atos Signs $1.8 Billion Finance Deal With Banks, Bondholders
feedItems.description: The agreement, which was first flagged earlier this month, comes after rescue talks between Atos and a consortium which included shareholder Onepoint fell apart late June.

feedItems.title: Luxury Shares Fall on China's Macroeconomic Challenges
feedItems.description: Shares in European luxury goods companies fell sharply as demand in the all-important Chinese market falters.

feedItems.title: Burberry Replaces CEO as Turnaround Effort Stalls
feedItems.description: British fashion brand Burberry replaced its chief executive officer and said it would halt its dividend amid a downturn in luxury spending—and after a turnaround effort showed signs of fizzling.
